str2: Therefore, then. Apparently a primary word; certainly, or accordingly.

parse: Verb - Perfect Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Plural

str2: The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
(a) fear, terror, alarm, (b) the object or cause of fear, (c) reverence, respect. From a primary phebomai; alarm or fright.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Lord, master, sir; the Lord. From kuros; supreme in authority, i.e. controller; by implication, Master.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 1st Person Plural
str2: A primary verb; to convince; by analogy, to pacify or conciliate; reflexively or passively, to assent, to rely.
A man, one of the human race. From aner and ops; man-faced, i.e. A human being.

parse: Verb - Perfect Indicative Middle or Passive - 1st Person Plural
str2: To make clear (visible, manifest), make known. From phaneros; to render apparent.
A deity, especially the supreme Divinity; figuratively, a magistrate; by Hebraism, very.
A primary particle; but, and, etc.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 1st Person Singular
str2: To hope, hope for, expect, trust. From elpis; to expect or confide.

parse: Verb - Perfect Infinitive Middle or Passive
str2: To make clear (visible, manifest), make known. From phaneros; to render apparent.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 2nd Person Plural
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
The conscience, a persisting notion. From a prolonged form of suneido; co-perception, i.e. Moral consciousness.
